baseTemplate.title: Initial setup
baseTemplate.note: Review how this destination is set up

fields.label: Select Account -> Property -> DataStream -> Protocol Secrets

groups.title: Connection mode
note: Update how you want to route events from your source to destination.

baseTemplate.note: Map source events to destination events and properties
baseTemplate.title: Event and property mappings

groups.title: Custom GA4 property mappings
groups.note: Confirm dimensions and metrics to link them to the event properties before sending events to Google Analytics 4

callout.message: Mappings take precedence over any transformations for the destination.

baseTemplate.title: Configuration settings
baseTemplate.note: Manage the settings for your destination

fields.label: Debug via Validation Server
note: Enabling this sends events to GA4's validation server. This allows you to check validation responses in Live Events, but note that

note.text: these events will not show up in reports.

note: For hybrid mode, these would be your track and group calls

fields.label: Filter user traits
fields.note: Use this field to filter sensitive PII fields like email, phone number, credit card number, etc. from your events and prevent them from being sent to GA4

groups.title: Hybrid mode settings
groups.note: Configure additional settings for hybrid mode here

fields.label: Choose how to capture pageviews
note: Choose whether you want to send page view events through the RudderStack JS SDK, or through automatic collection on each page load using GA4 Enhanced Measurement (gtag).
about how GA4 measures pages and screens

fields.label: Debug via DebugView
note: Enabling this allows you to monitor your device mode events in
For hybrid mode, these would be only your page calls

fields.label: Include URL and Search as Page View properties
fields.note: Enabling this extends the set of properties automatically collected to include 'URL' and 'search'.  Note that GA4 has a limit on the number of unique properties per event name

fields.label: Override gtag client ID & session ID
note: Override the gtag clientID & sessionID with RudderStack's to ensure attribution is properly unified across page and track events. We recommend turning on the override function. Otherwise, instrument your RudderStack SDK based on instructions

sections.title: Consent settings
sections.note: Configure consent settings for each provider here

groups.title: Client-side event filtering
groups.note: Decide what events are allowed (allowlisting) and blocked (denylisting)

fields.label: Choose if you want to turn on events filtering:
fields.note: You must select either allowlist or denylist to enable events filtering

fields.label: Allowlisted events
fields.note: Input separate events by pressing 'Enter'.nInput the events you want to allowlist.

fields.label: Denylisted events
fields.note: Input separate events by pressing 'Enter'.nInput the events you want to denylist.

rowFields.label: Enter consent category IDs
rowFields.note: Input your consent category IDs by pressing 'Enter' after each entry. We recommend using IDs instead of names as IDs are unique and less likely to change over time, making them a more reliable choice.

fields.label: Map RudderStack properties to GA4 dimensions and metrics (Note: These can be overriden per event level mapping)
Map RudderStack events to GA4 events
